item.title: When And How to Use Database Transactions in Laravel
item.description: Hello Artisan ðŸ˜Ž , Database transactions are often an overlooked feature, but Laravel makes it so effortless. One of the powerful ways to ensure data integrity is database transactions. Database transactions give a powerful ability to safely perform multiple database queries in a single transaction. If all queries run smoothly, then only it will commit otherwise it will roll back. For Example, we have an application where we create a user, assign a role to the created user, and add KYC (Know your customer).

item.title: How to Turn on Error Reporting in Wordpress
item.description: You got an error. The first thing we do is to check the error logs or reports. The logs or reports make it the developer or any tech guy easy to solve the problems. Today we will enable some of the hidden variables which can help us debug the WordPress errors more easily. These variables are mostly enabled only for the development process, not on production websites. Letâ€™s get to the point now.

item.title: Why Wordpress Prefer array() Instead of Short Array Syntax
item.description: Short array syntax [] was introduced a while back when PHP 5.4 was released. Basically it is ability to define arrays using [] instead of array(). <?php $arr1 = array( 'motto' => 'learning is fun.', 'url' => 'raisachin.com.np' ); $arr2 = [ 'motto' => 'learning is fun.', 'url' => 'raisachin.com.np' ]; echo '<pre>'; print_r($arr1); echo '</pre>'; Using any of the above will result the same output. WordPress prefer array() instead of short array syntax , because it can run on PHP 5.
